org.svvrl.goal.cmd
Interface Statement

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlockStmt, BreakStmt, ContinueStmt, ExitStmt, ForStmt, HelpStmt, IfStmt, InteractiveStmt, MultiSetStmt, SetStmt, TryStmt, WhileStmt
public interface Statement

A statement is a block of expressions containing control flows.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

Method Summary
 void dump(int indent)
          Dumps this statement as a string on the standard output.
 void eval(Context ctx)
          Evaluates this statement under a specified context.
 

Method Detail

eval

void eval(Context ctx)
          throws EvaluationException,
                 BreakException,
                 ContinueException
Evaluates this statement under a specified context.

Parameters:
ctx - the context for this evaluation
Throws:
EvaluationException - if there is an error during the evaluation
BreakException - if a break statement is evaluated during this evaluation
ContinueException - if a continue statement is evaluated during this evaluation

dump

void dump(int indent)
Dumps this statement as a string on the standard output.

Parameters:
indent - the number of indents for the string to be dumped.
